articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Coronavirus: The latest global developments
articles.description: The latest developments worldwide in the coronavirus crisis.
articles.content:
Here are the latest developments in the coronavirus crisis.
More than 700,000 cases 
More than 727,080 cases of infection and 34,610 deaths have been recorded in 183 countries and territories since the epidemic started in China in December, according latest… [+2321 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Drop in China's new coronavirus cases
articles.description: China has reported a drop in new coronavirus infections for a fourth day as drastic curbs on international travellers reined in the number of imported cases.
articles.content:
China has reported a drop in new coronavirus infections for a fourth day as drastic curbs on international travellers reined in the number of imported cases, while policymakers turned their efforts to healing the world's second-largest economy.

articles.author: RTÉ Sport
articles.title: Red Bull chief's coronavirus idea 'not well received'
articles.description: Red Bull motorsport chief Helmut Marko has revealed that his idea to allow the team's drivers to deliberately contract Covid-19 at a special training camp has stalled.
articles.content:
Red Bull motorsport chief Helmut Marko has revealed he suggested the team's drivers should try to become infected with coronavirus as it is the "ideal time" with the season on hold.
The start of the 2020 F1 season has been decimated by the global pandemic, w… [+1837 chars]

articles.author: Fran McNulty
articles.title: Sales of Irish cheese slumps 75% due to coronavirus
articles.description: Irish cheese makers say there has been a 75% drop in sales as a result of coronavirus.
articles.content:
Irish cheese makers say there has been a 75% drop in sales as a result of coronavirus. 
The closure of farmers markets has been a big issue and the closure of many food services outlets has also hit demand.
